course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Environmental History
course.description: This course provides students with an introduction to the field of environmental history focusing on the past one hundred years of environmental change around the globe. The course will explore different themes in environmental history, including the environmental impact of humans, the history of sustainable development, environmental justice movements and national programs of nature conservation.

reviews.author: 就黎升仙
reviews.title: Online Mode, This course is useless!
reviews.comment_content:
Module One: Fresh Water
Local Topic: Hong Kong Water Supply
Regional Topic: The Mekong River
Global Topic: Fresh water scarcity

Module Two: Global Climate Change
Local Topic: History of Flooding and landslips in Hong Kong
Regional Topic: Asian Cities: sinking and stifling
Global Topic: Climate-influenced famines and wars

Module Three: Sustainability
Local Topic: land reclamation in Hong Kong
Regional Topic: recycling in Asia  
Global Topic: Carbon credits: the history of an ecological idea

Module Four: Pollution
Local Topic: plastics on Hong Kong shorelines
Regional topic: History of air pollution in Asia
Global topic: light pollution

Module Five: Agro-ecology
Local Topic: Hong Kong farms
Regional Topic: History of rice paddies and their ecosystems
Global Topic: Farms as polluters

Module Six: Conservation
Local Topic: Hiking trails and Country Parks in Hong Kong
Regional Topic: Conserving Tigers and Elephants in Asia
Global Topic: The rise of environmental NGOs

P.S.
Modules 1 to 4 are also covered in SUST1000 :)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor doesn't like to reply emails. Receive reply after 2 weeks.
reviews.comment_grading:
QOTD: 20%
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 10%
Quiz 3: 10%
Final Timeline Project: 20%
Mini Lecture: 10%
Book Review: 20%

Mean: 80.33
My score: 79.5 --> Grade: B
This course should be absolute grading and same as other HUMA courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to attend every lecture for quizzes and QOTD (can answer in Discussions in Canvas). For quizzes, you also need to watch movies and reading materials.

Book Review: Read a book with more than 300 pages

reviews.author: CS水泡
reviews.title: Content is pretty interesting, but not very useful in some fields of studies
reviews.comment_content:
Talks about various topics from global and local perspective. A lot of them links back to environmental and cultural history of Hong Kong.

Talks all things from water, conservation, domestication to zoology of specific animals. Class only covers 60% and the rest are reading material.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is chill albeit a tad early in the morning, and professor is happy to answer questions related to class material or arrangements.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is lean and partial marks are given appropriately. Participation is important but you can do the questions on canvas on the same day. However, the grade cutoff is strict. I got a 89.3% and it is still a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The main load besides quizzes and finals are the presentation, a review essay based on one of the reading materials and an unguided "field trip". The last one is just a worksheet that you fill up before and after going to the specified places.

Reading material can feel unimportant and not heavily mentioned until the first quiz comes, but it is too late to read them all by the time. If you don't like reading, don't take this course.
